newsitem.title: USA: Informix sees Q1 revs lower than Q4.
newsitem.headline: Informix sees Q1 revs lower than Q4.

text.p: Informix Corp Chief Financial Officer Alan Henricks Wednesday reiterated the company expects revenues in the first quarter of 1997 to be lower than in the fourth quarter of 1996.
Henricks also said expenses should be higher.
"We have said sequentially revenue would be down and expenses would be up from Q4," Henricks told Reuters after giving a presentation at the Robertson Stephens Technology Conference.

He said the company has given no specific guidance on 1997 expectations but he repeated it expects to see more revenue growth in the second half of the year after a transition period in which the company expands staffing to support its new line of products.

Henricks and Informix Chief Executive Phil White both declined to comment on earnings projections, but Wall Street analysts generally expect first quarter earnings per share to be roughly flat with the $0.13 a share it earned in the first quarter of 1996.
In the fourth quarter of 1996, Informix reported revenues of $270.8 milion and in the first quarter of 1996 it posted revenues $204 million.
Robertson Stephens analyst Marshall Senk estimates Informix will earn a profit of $0.14 a share in the first quarter of 1997 on revenues of $250 milion.
